title: 3XFlag-pATn5 Protein Purification and MEDS-loading (5x scale, 2L volume)
title_html: 3XFlag-pATn5 Protein Purification and MEDS-loading (5x scale, 2L volume)

authors.name: Terri Bryson
authors.affiliation: Fred Hutchinson Cancer Research Center, HHMI

source.description:
Streak E. coli glycerol stock containing pTXB1-rbs_3XFlag-pATn5-FL plasmid onto an LB-Amp100 plate, incubate
at
Select a single colony and make a patch plate for later, use within 1 week.

Early morning, with a sterile toothpick swipe through a bacterial patch to inoculate
of LB broth+ carbenicillin 100ug/mL culture, let shake ~
.

Put
of LB+ carbenicillin 100ug/mL in 6L flask at
as well so it is already warm at the time of dilution.

source.body: Carbenicillin can be used in place of ampicillin. Carbenicillin is more stable, so it is potentially more effective at selecting only bacteria containing the plasmids of interest (for example, fewer satellite colonies will grow). However, it is also more expensive.

source.description: Make buffers and media.

After
incubation use all 30 ml of starter culture to inoculate larger vessel.

Shake at
, check OD600 periodically until it reaches O.D600 of 0.5-0.7. ~
Move to cold room to let cool ~

Induce culture with addition of fresh 1M IPTG to 0.25mM final and incubate on the
shaker ~

Pellet bacteria by centrifugation: Divide the culture between 6x
bottles, centrifuge at 9500rcf, 4C for
in a GS3 Rotor, RC5C Sorvall centrifuge.
Discard the supernatant.
Freeze bacterial pellets in dry ice and ethanol bath.

Store at
freezer until ready to process.

Remove pellets from freezer, thaw on ice and resuspend together in a combined total of
of chilled HEGX Buffer with Roche Complete EDTA free protease inhibitor (PI) tablets. Keep on ice while working.

source.body: Need today; make a total of 1L HEGX and add PI tablets as needed each day.

source.description: Divide combined resuspension between 4x clean 100 ml plastic beakers nested in a larger plastic beaker filled with ice. See figure A.

While keeping in the ice nest, sonicate each sample 10-12 times,
each at 50% duty cycle and output level 7 on a Branson Sonifier 250 fitted with the Branson Ultrasonics™ Sonifier™ micro-tip. Between rounds of sonication keep in larger ice bucket (see figure A) and use a 2mL serological pipette to gently stir to facilitate cooling. Let each sample rest at least
between sonication rounds.

source.body: To prevent foaming keep the sonicator tip in the center of the sample. If excessive foaming occurs during sonication either wait for foam to settle or remove with a pipette and discard.

source.description:
Transfer to fresh 50 mL conical tubes and pellet the lysate by centrifugation for
,
, at
.

In
prepare 10x Econo-Pac® Chromatography Columns (BIO-RAD 732-1010), each holds
Set-up columns (we use a rack intended for Qiagen Maxi-preps, figure B). Gently invert Chitin Resin (NEB S6651S) to fully suspend and add 2.5mL to each column. Wash each with
of HEGX Buffer, drain immediately, don’t collect anything. Do not let resin dry out prior to addition of sample.

source.body: Chitin Binding: The remainder of the protocol is carried out at or on ice. All buffers should be chilled on ice prior to use.

source.description: Add yellow cap to bottom of column.
Add supernatant from lysate spin to Chitin Resin slowly to prevent bubbles.

Cap column tightly and incubate
at
on nutator. Check for leakage after
and
, wrap both ends in parafilm if necessary to prevent leakage.

source.title: Day 6: Wash and Cleavage Intein with DTT.

source.description:
Return columns to rack: remove yellow cap gently, hang rack over collection tube and uncap column. Drain unbound fraction into 50 mL tubes (save on ice or at
in the event troubleshooting is required later).

source.title: Day 6: Wash and Cleavage Intein with DTT.

source.description:
Wash column 2x with
HEGX collecting first wash into 50 mL tubes (save on ice or at
in the event troubleshooting is required later), the second wash can be wasted.

source.title: Day 6: Wash and Cleavage Intein with DTT.

source.description: Add yellow cap to bottom of column.

source.title: Day 6: Wash and Cleavage Intein with DTT.

source.description:
Make
HEGX +PI with 100mM DTT and slowly add
to each sample.

source.title: Day 6: Wash and Cleavage Intein with DTT.

source.description: Cap column tightly and nutate in cold room ~

Return columns to rack: remove yellow cap gently, hang in rack over collection tube and uncap column. Drain unbound fraction into 15 mL conical tubes, combine at end. Cover resin with additional
of buffer and save at
until purification is verified.
Record elution volume. ~
Dialyze the protein as described in the following substeps.
Separate dialyzed protein between 4x Millipore Centrifugal Filter Units 30K, Amicon Ultra-15 Cat# UFC903024

Spin in Eppendorf 5804R at
and
for
. Check at
intervals to assess progress, do not let volume drop below top of filters.
Recover concentrated sample from the upper filter portion of the tube, use an extra 500uL of buffer from lower catch tube to wash any extra protein off of each filter and add to collected protein.

source.body: Volume recovered from Concentrator: 7 mL + 2mL for rinsing filter = 9 mL

source.description: Add an equal volume of sterile 80% glycerol to the concentrated protein. Combined with the glycerol from dialysis the final glycerol concentration is ~50%.

Store at
.

Run small volume of purified protein (and some from a previous batch if available) to compare yields. Include BSA standard range for quantification if desired. To the 3x Loading Dye from CSH Protocols, add 2-mercaptoethanol to 15% final before adding to the protein samples, heat to
for
cool back to
prior to loading onto gel.

source.body:
Material:
• Novex; 4-20% Tris-Glycine Gel 1.0 mm, 12 well WEDGE, Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# XP04120PK2
• Pierce™ Bovine Serum Albumin Standard Pre-Diluted Set, Thermo Fisher Scientific cat# 23208
• PageRuler™ Plus Prestained Protein Ladder, 10 to 250 kDa, Thermo Fisher Scientific cat 26620
• 2-Mercaptoethanol, BIO-RAD cat#1610710
• 1xTris Glycine Buffer

After loading samples run gel at 30mA for ~
or until the loading dye leading edge runs to the bottom of the gel.

Transfer gel carefully to covered dish with Coomassie stain gently shake at least
to
at
.
Replace stain with destain, add a rolled paper towel to dish to absorb excess Coomassie dye.
Replace destain with water, scan gel for notes.

Assemble 2 Slide-A-Lyzer 10K MWCO Dialysis Cassettes
  • Use a medium (1 ¼ inch) binder clip to secure a 2 inch stir bar and remove the clip handles gently. Use an 18-inch zip tie to secure a foam float to the cassette. See figure C.
  • Hydrate the cassette by submerging and use a binder clip to anchor the cassette at the proper depth by clipping the zip tie tail to the lip of the dialysis beaker. Let hydrate according to product instructions

Using an 18 gauge needle load the Slide-A-Lyzer Cassettes with
each. Follow product literature on how to properly load cassettes.

In a 4 L beaker, add both cassettes and dialyze for
-
in
of Tn5 dialysis buffer with DTT added to 1.7mM just before use.

Move samples to fresh Tn5 dialysis buffer, also
with DTT added to 1.7mM just before use, let dialyze
at
.

Recover sample from cassette and combine into a fresh 50mL conical tube. Hold on ice or at
until next steps. Overnight storage is ok if this falls into a weekend.

Resuspend single-stranded salt-free oligos from Eurofins to 200uM in Annealing Buffer (10mM Tris
, 50mM NaCl, 1mM EDTA).

Mix equal volumes of both complementary oligos (at equimolar concentration) in a
microfuge tube, mix well and aliquot to in smaller tubes appropriate for thermal cycler.

Verify annealing:
Run oligos, both ss and ds, on a 6% acrylamide 1xTBE (figure E) Lanes:
1. 1KB+ Marker 3uL
2. Rev+ ME-A 1uL +1uL 6X Fermentas Orange Loading Dye +6uL TE
3. Rev+ ME-B 1uL +1uL 6X Fermentas Orange Loading Dye +6uL TE
4. Rev 1uL +1uL 6X Fermentas Orange Loading Dye +6uL TE
5. ME-A 0.5uL +1uL 6X Fermentas Orange Loading Dye +6uL TE
6. ME-B 0.5uL +1uL 6X Fermentas Orange Loading Dye +6uL TE
7. 100 bp Marker 3uL

source.body: While annealing efficiency is not 100% it is robust, excess ssDNA will not load onto transposase and will wash away during CUT&Tag protocol.

source.title: Assembly of Tn5 with pre-annealed MEDS and in vitro assay to verify tagmentation activity

source.description:
With oligo-mer:
The mixture is incubated for ~
at
and then stored at
.

In vitro activity assay is performed on 150 ng HMW Lambda DNA (NEB# N3011). Unloaded pATn5 or loaded pATN5 without MgCl2 should have no impact on HMW DNA, loaded pATN5 in digestion buffer should digest HMW DNA to a smear. See figure F.

For each sample prepare the following reaction mix:
HMW DNA
5XTAPS-MgCl2-PEG8000 (water for no digestion buffer controls)
pATn5-MEDS complex

Incubate for
at
.

To release and inactivate Tn5, add
of 1%SDS (disrupt protein DNA interaction).

Incubate for
at
or
.

Add
proteinase K (20 mg/mL) to each reaction (degrade pATn5).

Incubate for
at
.

Keep
or
.
The samples can be analyzed by migration on 0.7% agarose gel in 1xTAE.

source.body:
Gel Lanes: (figure F)
1. 150ng HMW lambda DNA
2. 1KB+ MW Marker
3. pATn5 (-) MEDS
4. pATn5 (+) MEDS, (-) digestion buffer
5. pATn5 (+) MEDS, (+) digestion buffer
6. pATn5[batch 2], (+) MEDS, (+) digestion buffer

description: Here we describe the method used to purify and load pATn5 for CUT&Tag, https://www.protocols.io/view/bench-top-cut-amp-tag-z6hf9b6/abstract. This protocol was modeled after that in Picelli et al (Picelli et al., 2014) using the pTXB1-rbs_3XFlag-pATn5-FL plasmid available from Addgene: https://www.addgene.org/124601/. It yields, as written, used at 1:200 dilution in CUT&Tag reactions, and for future use, both of which should be stored at -20C and can easily be scaled down.
